summary: The "Lublin province," categorized under regions of EU Member States, plays a significant role in the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks. This province, located in Poland, is associated with various agricultural products that may receive Protected Geographical Indication (PGI) status. Such designations ensure that products bearing the name "Lublin" meet specific quality standards and originate from this region. The European Commission publishes regulations that facilitate the application process for these indications, ensuring compliance with EU treaties. As of November, the functioning of these schemes is governed by official statements and entries in the EU journal, reflecting the commitment to quality and protection of regional foodstuffs.
